history.content:
If you're leaning towards CS and want a lightweight fun course to take alongside those two, I'd recommend CS188. If you're definitely planning on taking more EE courses in the future, then think about EE120 as it is considered fundamental for the rest of the upper division EE courses.

I would say both CS188 and EE120 have relatively lightweight workloads, but you'll have to spend a good amount of time studying for the exams (just like any other upper division EECS course).

If you're leaning towards CS and want a light-weight fun course to take alongside those two, I'd recommend CS188. If you're definitely planning on taking more EE courses in the future, then think about EE120 as it is considered fundamental for the rest of the upper division EE courses.

children.subject:
I don't know how high the workload is for EE149. 

CS170 is a medium to high workload class (weekly problem sets) as is EE127.

If EE149 is a high workload class (I'd recommend talking to someone who has taken it to determine this), consider holding off on EE127, especially if you aren't taking it to prepare for CS189 or another class in the spring or aren't super interested in ML/optimization.

If EE149 isn't a high workload class and you are interested in ML/optimization I'd say that adding EE127 would be ok (it'll still be a difficult semester). You'll still have to work a lot, but you can make it through if you've done well in high workload semesters in the past and are able to put in the time.
127 homework takes less time than 170 but the material is harder
Thank you! Would adding 127 be too heavy given the other classes ?
It varies from person to person, but you can assume that 170 psets will be comparable to 70 psets.

agree on the variability. But 170 is generally harder than 70, but a different kind of difficulty. Algorithmic thinking often comes easier to those who have experience with it, much like 70 will be easier if you've taken AP Stats before.
how much load is CS170 compared to CS70?  70 workload psets were pretty bad after the 2nd week but after the midpoint it seems pretty manageable.  Is 170 like this also?

history.content: I’m a junior transfer and I’m a bit lost on what courses to take in fall 2019. I would say that I don’t have a focus I’m just a generalist, leaning towards cs, and I plan on taking CS170 and EECS149 in the fall. I was wondering if there is a 3rd course I could add that is not too heavy and also useful for industry. I have a list of courses I would like to take but they all seem a bit heavy to take with 170 and 149, this is the list: 127, 162, 189, 161, 186. I’ve heard people say that 120 is a good course to take and that it is useful for both cs and ee but I’m also interested in 188. So my question is what course could I take with 170 and 149? Would 127 be too heavy with those? And, is 120 actually that helpful ? Thank you in advance for any advice!
history.subject: Workload thoughts
